intro: Vesiculina albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered bladderwort, is a unique aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures called vesicles, which are used for trapping microscopic organisms. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and marshes. Its flowers are white and clustered in racemes, adding to its ornamental appeal. Vesiculina albiflora is a carnivorous plant, relying on both photosynthesis and nutrient uptake from captured prey.
